chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deyvi Rivera Carrasco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: One (1) day credit if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Comply with any HHS request or orders. 
----------------------------------
Court grants expunction upon successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt: Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment
Notice of Post-Conviction Rights
BOND QUASHED

9:36am Court in session

Defendant Deyvi Rivera Carrasco present in court with interpreter Saul Arteaga & Attorney Steven Spear. DDA James Sempf appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are free to argue sentence

Plea questionnaire filed with the Court by Atty Spear
Court has plea colloquy with Deft
Court gives warnings as to deportation, voting ineligibility & firearm restriction. Deft acknowledges. 

Deft pleads guilty to Ct #1
Court finds factual basis exists, adjudges Deft guilty

State is in compliance with victims rights, no victim impact statement or restitution requested

Argument & Recommendation by DDA Sempf
Argument & Recommendation by Atty Spear

Deft does not wish to make statement
Deft responds to Court's questions

Court makes record & sentences Deft: 

Ct #1-
Withheld sentence
18 months probation

Conditions of Probation to include:

Payment of all costs, fees & surcharges
DNA Sample & Surcharge
Counseling as recommended by the agent
Comply with any HHS requests or orders

Court is granting expunction upon successful completion of probation

Deft has 1 day credit if revoked. 

10:05am Court in recess
